title: Frank Lloyd Wright's smallest residential design is available to rent in Wisconsin
author: Josh Niland
excerpt: Looking for a unique Midwestern getaway this new year? Well, you're in luck: Frank Lloyd Wright’s one-bedroom Seth Peterson Cottage (his smallest executed design) is now available for short-term rentals in Wisconsin. More details can be found on the rental company's listing page, which...
text: anchor Image: Brendannee/CC BY-SA 4.0 Looking for a unique Midwestern getaway this new year? Well, you're in luck: Frank Lloyd Wright’s one-bedroom Seth Peterson Cottage (his smallest executed design) is now available for short-term rentals in Wisconsin. More details can be found on the rental company's listing page, which indicates up to four people can stay in the space with prices beginning at $325 a night. The Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation says it "boil[s] down Wright’s design philosophy to its essence" while possessing a "monumentality" that belies its small (880-square-foot) size. Interested in a more permanent experience? You can also build your own version of the cottage using plans from the Seattle-based home construction company Lindal Cedar Homes. (h/t Travel + Leisure for the rental tip)
